result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick O Schmelzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Reimburse the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money. (this has been paid from cash bond posted)
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

$250 fine plus costs on each count. (cash bond applied)   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1. Huber release granted. 30 days to report.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick O Schmelzer in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Patrick O Schmelzer in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Patrick O Schmelzer in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick O Schmelzer in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates their office is in the process of getting counsel appointed, waiting for some information from defendant before counsel can be appointed. Court reschedules. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court sets AIA. Bond remains in effect. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Patrick O Schmelzer appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
